UTF-7: 1 for "direct characters" (depends on the encoder setting for some code points), 2 for U+002B "+", otherwise same as for 000080 – 00FFFF
5 for an isolated case inside a run of single byte characters. For runs ?2 2?3 per character plus padding to make it a whole number of bytes plus two to start and finish the run
2–6 depending on if the byte values need to be escaped
UTF-16 base64: 4–6 for characters inherited from GB2312/GBK (e.g. most Chinese characters) 8 for everything else.
?2 2?3 for characters inherited from GB2312/GBK (e.g. most Chinese characters) ?5 1?3 for everything else.

UTF-7: 8 for isolated case, ?5 1?3 per character plus padding to integer plus 2 for a run
8–12 depending on if the low bytes of the surrogates need to be escaped.
